intro: Dalzellia foliosa, commonly known as the broad-leafed dalzellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red, and they bloom in clusters. Dalzellia foliosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and vibrant floral display.
